pr_title: WFLY-4699 Expose EJB3 deployment information at runtime

timeline.bodyText: @chengfang I can't find tests related to Bean statistics (execution-time, invocations, methods, peak-concurrent-invocations and wait-time) for Message-driven Beans: I expected to find those tests in EjbInvocationStatisticsTestCase but it only covers SLSB, SFSB and Singletons; can you point me at them?
timeline.author: tommaso-borgato

replies.bodyText: @tommaso-borgato  these bean stats are existing features (already there before we implement this feature), so they are not covered by this PR.
replies.author: chengfang

timeline.bodyText:
@chengfang For all the various LIST attributes you should used one of the ListAttributeDefinition impls. My guess is all of them are essentially List of String, so use StringListAttributeDefinition. The pattern would be
static final SimpleAttributeDefinition JNDI_NAMES = StringListAttributeDefinition.Builder.of("jndi-names")     

followed by what you've got now.
This results in the management API description having the correct 'value-type' as discussed in https://docs.wildfly.org/19.1/Admin_Guide.html#description-of-an-attribute
